thread.title: Jubilant Kenny Jackett: Our season starts now
thread.title_full: Jubilant Kenny Jackett: Our season starts now

title: Jubilant Kenny Jackett: Our season starts now
text:
Tweet 
A second successive 3-0 victory propelled Jackett’s team into the Championship play-off picture, just a week after they were only three points off the bottom of the league. 
And while not getting carried away with his team’s form, Jackett expressed his delight at the victory over Huddersfield – and bemoaned the two-week break before their next fixture owning to the international break. 
He said: “We’ve got seven points out of nine, there’s the opportunity to do that in this league, and we’re disappointed the international break has now come. 
“The big thing is now our season is ahead of us and we have to keep building.” 
McDonald, who has withdrawn from the Scotland squad with a back injury, scored one and Afobe the other two as Wolves picked up their third clean sheet of the season. What do you think? Log in and start commenting 
The pair have both dealt with off-the-field distractions and been far from at their best this season, but played a crucial role in Saturday’s victory. 
Jackett added: “Maybe Afobe was distracted, it would be the case for any young player, it’s tough, but he’s been a big player for us and he’s only been here since January. We think he has a very good future at 22 and he’s really got his confidence at Wolves. More on this story:
